com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions

Class Dirichlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorFunction
      • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.Dirichlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactorFunction, IParametricFactorFunction

    public class Dirichlet
extends FactorFunction
implements IParametricFactorFunction
    Factor for an exchangeable set of Dirichlet distributed variables associated with a variable or fixed parameter vector. The variables are ordered as follows in the argument list: 1) Parameters (non-negative RealJoint variable). 2...) An arbitrary number of RealJoint variables, each one a Dirichlet distributed random variable. The parameters may optionally be specified as constants in the constructor. In this case, the parameters are not included in the list of arguments.

      • evalEnergy

        public final double evalEnergy(Value[] arguments)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorFunction
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to -log(IFactorFunction.eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

      • copyParametersInto

        public int copyParametersInto(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Description copied from interface: IParametricFactorFunction
        Copies the current parameter values in provided parameters map.

        This will do nothing if IParametricFactorFunction.hasConstantParameters() is false.

        Specified by:
        copyParametersInto in interface IParametricFactorFunction
        Parameters:
        parameters - is a map into which the entries will be written. Existing entries may be overwritten if they match an added parameter name, but will otherwise be left alone.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that were added to the map.

      • getParameter

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Object getParameter(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Description copied from interface: IParametricFactorFunction
        Returns the value of the specified parameter.

        Specified by:
        getParameter in interface IParametricFactorFunction
        Parameters:
        parameterName - identifies the parameter. Some factors may provide more than one way to retrieve a parameter.
        Returns:
        the parameter value or null if there is no such parameter with the given parameterName or if IParametricFactorFunction.hasConstantParameters() is false.

      • hasConstantParameters

        public final boolean hasConstantParameters()
        Description copied from interface: IParametricFactorFunction
        Indicates that the function's parameters are stored as constants within the factor function itself.

        If false, then the parameters will instead need to be provided as variables attached to the factor. See the documentation for the specific function for details as to how the variables should be ordered, but most often parameter variables come first.

        Not that when true the parameter is only "constant" in the sense that it is not represented as a variable in the graph. Some factor functions may still allow the value of the parameter to be changed after construction.

        Specified by:
        hasConstantParameters in interface IParametricFactorFunction
